profile.likes: Battle, exciting fights, the smell of gunpowder

background.story: Known to some as the Song of the Silver Madness, he is incredibly insincere in everything he does. He shows absolutely no sense of responsibility in regard to those around him. Once he engages in a combat, though, he turns into an untouchable silver wolf that storms across the battlefield. Nothing is known about his past. One thing is certain: he does not distinguish between friend and foe once the madness of battle takes over him. Staying near him when he's in this state may be far more dangerous than holding onto a ticking time bomb.

itemIntroductions.weapon: A pair of magical weapons that absorb the bloodlust of their user to enhance their own firepower. Each pull of their triggers pushes the user deeper and deeper into the craze of the battle. It is said that when a master craftsman creates a weapon, it develops a soul. Berkinos seem to have the soul of the war god. According to the story, when their creator pulled their triggers for the first time, he suddenly turned pale with terror and threw them into a river.
itemIntroductions.soul:
The flash from the barrels of Velkinoth did not fade. As the smoke from its gunpowder entwined with the scent of blood, it lost its distinct smell. And yet, Mitra did not stop. The scenes of unstoppable carnage eventually awakened the soul of madness that was dormant inside Velkinoth. The newly-awakened soul liked the way how Mitra went full berserk in battles. Above all, it liked how Mitra released his madness through its barrels. But Velkinoth wanted to release even more madness whenever Mitra pulled the trigger. It wanted to release its madness until its body was all burned.
Eventually, Velkinoth's desire resonated with Mitra's soul and gave birth to its new form as the embodiment of madness.

'Damn!! This is awesome!'
treasures: Velkinoth's speedloader that's custom-made for faster reload. Hot-tempered Mitra used to complain that he wanted to shoot his enemies faster with Velkinoth's crazy rate of fire, but its slow reload speed kept getting in the way. One day, when Mitra was complaining as he always had been, Crow suddenly appeared in front of him. - Oh? Old... Kugh! Crow punched Mitra in the stomach, threw something at him, then went away. - Use that and stop complaining. Is this just his unique way of showing he cares?

Steel Wolf's special barrage box. The Steel Wolves were infamous for being too violent and making it impossible to revitalize their enemies. The most infamous Silver Wolf only uses the maximized Wolf Barrage Box that he got from the owner of the Gold Bar.

Rune of the greatest mercenaries, the Steel Wolves. A rune that symbolizes the mercenary Steel Wolves, who were called the demons of the battlefield. Mitra was called the Silver Wolf of the battlefield. Even after he's left the mercenaries, he carries it in remembrance of the battle against the naval officer of the empire.

A bullet necklace that Valance, the chief of Magos Le'Flamme, made especially for Mitra. It looks like an ordinary necklace, but it is actually a bullet with devastating explosive power. With the cutting-edge technology of Magos Le'Flamme, it was made solely to be loaded to Velkinoth. As its ingredients were very rare, making a single bullet took a long time. Valance decided to call it the Song of Madness, a name that fits the madness that Mitra shows in the battlefield.
